item.title: Plain vanilla theme for Hugo
item.description:
If you are creating a website, chances are that you are at least considering building it using static site generator such as Hugo. There are plenty themes ready available for Hugo, but if you are creating one from scratch then Bootstrap is an obvious choice. Anyway, Glitchshop Minimal Theme theme will give you a leg up.

It is designed to use externally hosted CSS and Javascript libraries and minimal custom CSS to add formatting touches where needed while providing basic blog functionality.

This blog is powered by Hugo and uses Glitchshop Minimal Theme.

Resources

  • Hugo
  • Bootstrap v4 alpha
  • Glitchshop Minimal Theme for Hugo

Configuration details

Below is an example of TOML front matter that includes description, categories and tags used with this theme:

+++
date = "2017-12-02T23:18:50Z"
draft = false
title = "Plain vanilla theme for Hugo"
description = "A simple starter theme for Hugo made with Bootstrap 4 alpha 6"
author = "Bostjan"
categories = [ "Static Website"]
tags = [ "Hugo", "Bootstrap" ]
featured = "/media/content/hugo-bootstrap-minimal-theme-feature.jpg"
+++

...

A sample configuration file (config.toml):

languageCode = "en-us"
baseurl = "http://glitchshop.com/"
theme = "glitchshop-minimal-theme"
title = "Glitchshop"
copyright = "Copyright © 2016-2017 Bostjan Osenar. All rights reserved."
pluralizeListTitles = false
paginate = 18

[permalinks]
  post = "/:year/:month/:title/"

SectionPagesMenu = "main"
[[menu.main]]
  name = "Home"
  identifier = "home"
  url = "/"
  weight = 0
[[menu.main]]
  name = "Projects"
  identifier = "projects"
  url = "/projects/"
  weight = 1
[[menu.main]]
  name = "Blog"
  identifier = "blog"
  url = "/blog/"
  weight = 2

[params]
  logo = "media/branding/glitchshop-white-lg.png"
[params.home]
  postsSection = "blog"
  postsSectionLink = "/blog/"
  projectsSection = "projects"
[params.social]
  linkedin = "https://www.linkedin.com/in/bosenar"
  github = "https://github.com/BostjanOsenar"

[taxonomies]
  category = "categories"
  tag = "tags"

item.title: Under the Sea Live Wallpaper
item.description:
A live wallpaper for Android devices that is ending its 4th year on Google Play with more than 1.7 million downloads and an average score of 4.0. The project took roughly six months to complete and was first published on Google Play in late 2012.

Made using OpenGL ES 2.0 in its purest form. Just shaders over very simple geometry. It was optimised for high-end devices availaibe at launch time, devices like Samsung Galaxy S2. Designed and developed in collaboration with Goran Golubovic and published under Aksis Plus.
